metadata.title: CVE-2024-26677 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: rxrpc:Fix delayed ACKs to not set the reference serial number Fix theconstruction of delayed ACKs to not set the reference serial number as theycan't be used as an RTT reference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-lowlatency - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-aws - 4.4.0-1136.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.142').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
